summary:
Pilar Mata Dupont is an artist living between Australia and the Netherlands. Spanning video, performance, and photography, Mata Dupont’s work aids her research into the malleability and fallibility of structures of history, gender, and memory, and often combines many seemingly disparate references to create a new, and often dreamlike, visual world where these themes can be investigated. Using highly theatrical and cinematic methods, she re-imagines histories and classical texts, creating alternative readings that question the conditions of the construction of dominant narratives that shape Western society. Her Argentinean background, and upbringing in Australia, Argentina, and Brunei Darussalam – all settler states and/or former colonies or protectorates – feed into her practice.

Her solo exhibition, 'Only Weeds Emerge', opened at TENT Rotterdam in late 2018. More recently, her work exhibited at at The National: New Australian Art at the Art Gallery of NSW, curated by Isobel Parker Philip; and 'Into the Open', presented by Te Papa for New Zealand Festival. She was recently awarded a development grant as part of the Ian Potter Moving Image Commission for her work-in-progress, 'La Piedra'.

In July 2015, she was the winner of the main award at the Plymouth Contemporary Open Art Prize in the UK. In October 2015, she won the Residency Prize for the Wexner Center for the Arts at Videobrasil, in São Paulo, Brazil. Other recent exhibition highlights include the Box at the Wexner Center for the Arts, Ohio; SeMA Biennale – Mediacity Seoul, at the Seoul Museum of Art; Salon Fluchthilfe, at Secession in Vienna and Württem. Kunstverein, Stuttgart and Rencontres Internationales, Paris.

In collaboration with Tarryn Gill, she participated in the 17th Sydney Biennale and won the Basil Sellers Art Prize in 2010. As part of multi-artform collective Hold Your Horses, she made work commissioned by the Akademie der Künste in Berlin, 2012. Mata Dupont has work in the collections of the Art Gallery of Western Australia, Campbelltown Arts Centre, University of Western Australia, Artbank, the City of Perth, Queensland Art Gallery and Stadiums Queensland.

treasury_media.title: 'Undesirable Bodies' a new exhibition by Pilar Mata Dupont
treasury_media.description:
Filmed in the hauntingly beautiful Pilbara region in Australia, Undesirable Bodies challenges Euro-centric notions of beauty with a striking three-screen video. Using invasive species of flora as her protagonists, Mata Dupont explores conflicting contemporary issues at Jirndawurrunha, the immediate area surrounding a natural freshwater spring in Millstream Chichester National Park, sacred to the Yindjibarndi people. 
For more info please see: https://pilarmatadupont.com/Undesirable-Bodies

treasury_media.title: Excerpt of 'Mountain' - Pilar Mata Dupont
treasury_media.description:
http://www.pilarmatadupont.com/Mountain 
2015 Single channel projection with sound 8:11min Edition of 5 
'Mountain' investigates Sigmund Freud’s connection to the neighbouring villages of Berchtesgaden and Schönau am Königssee, in Bavaria, Germany, where he often spent his holidays between the late 1800s and 1929.

treasury_media.title: Excerpts of 'Zauberberg' - Pilar Mata Dupont
treasury_media.description: http://pilarmatadupont.com/Zauberberg 2016 single channel, high definition video colour, sound 22:04min In this adaptation of Thomas Mann's 'Der Zauberberg', Rose arrives at a tuberculosis sanatorium for a three-week stay to visit her cousin, languishing in the mountain retreat. After being diagnosed with a “moist spot" in her lung, Rose becomes enchanted by the mountain and her fellow inmates, and increasingly becomes obsessed with her cousin, the good soldier, Joachim.

treasury_media.title: 'Kaiho I' Trailer - Pilar Mata Dupont
treasury_media.description: 2011/12 HD Film 3:47min This work was created in Finland in 2011 and forms part of the 'Kaiho' series, a video based triptych relating to the concept of the 'kaiho' (Finland's version of saudade or longing for something unobtainable).

treasury_media.title: The Embrace (이상적인 포옹) Trailer - Pilar Mata Dupont
treasury_media.description:
2013
Single-channel High Definition digital video 
full film 5:04min
colour, sound
Edition of 3
The two figures from the 'Three Charters for National Reunification' monument near Pyongyang embrace in joy, only to have their bliss dissipate and a new, and unexpectedly uncomfortable, era to emerge. 
www.pilarmatadupont.com

treasury_media.title: AVERNUS Trailer - a film by Pilar Mata Dupont
treasury_media.description: 2012 HD film - shot on RED feature film version: 5:20min extended version: 8:30min This work has been developed in collaboration between the CineB Festival, Chile and MUBI. Working with the Nine Inch Nails album 'Ghosts I - IV' and 36 international directors a feature film is currently being created based on the Orpheus and Eurydice myth.

school.name: Western Australian Academy of Performing Arts

projects.title: 'AVERNUS' Trailer
projects.description:
This work has been developed in collaboration between the CineB Festival, Chile and MUBI. Working with the Nine Inch Nails album 'Ghosts I - IV' and 36 international directors a feature film is currently being created based on the Orpheus and Eurydice myth.
The feature film is due for release in 2013 and will tour to London and New York.
festivalcineb.com

In this particular work the artist experiments with creating a narrative as a hybrid of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth and various collected memories associated with loss, and the moments leading up to the loss of a person from one's life, through death or another form of parting. The movement was developed between the director and the two performers and was designed to reflect the transient movements of water and the act of washing/cleansing.


DIRECTOR
Pilar Mata Dupont

PRODUCER
John Barker

CAST
Eurydice - Quindell Orton
Orpheus - Russell Leonard

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
Tim Fay

PRODUCTION DESIGNER
Pilar Mata Dupont

EDITOR

Matt Cabrera

SECOND CAMERA ASSISTANT
Josh Magee

ASSISTANT EDITOR

SET DRESSER
Veronica Cotea

MAKE-UP AND HAIR
Freena Hamilton

CHOREOGRAPHY
Russell Leonard, Pilar Mata Dupont, Quindell Orton

BOOM OPERATOR
Alex Cahill

UNIT MANAGER/STILLS PHOTOGRAPHY
James Hensby

FILM TITLES
Sam Smith


Special Thanks to His Majesty's Theatre, James Hensby, James Cockram and the Red Castle Motel, and Spank FX.
Shot on a RED EPIC from Wide Eye Productions
Filmed on location at the Red Castle Motel, Rivervale, Western Australia

profile_positions.description: I have written grant applications for various artists and galleries in Australia and the Netherlands over the last years with a high success rate. Please contact me for more details and rates.
profile_positions.title: Grant writer

profile_positions.description: Duties Include: Assisting the production of exhibition installation at venues like TENT Rotterdam and the Eye Film Museum, Amsterdam, formatting exports and colour editing for artists screen-based works, assisting the project management of exhibition installations in close consultation with the producers, artist/s, curatorial, and installation teams.
profile_positions.title: Editor and project assistant

profile_positions.description:
Pilar Mata Dupont is an artist living between Australia and the Netherlands. Spanning video, performance, and photography, Mata Dupont’s work aids her research into the malleability and fallibility of structures of history, gender, and memory, and often combines many seemingly disparate references to create a new, and often dreamlike, visual world where these themes can be investigated. Using highly theatrical and cinematic methods, she re-imagines histories and classical texts, creating alternative readings that question the conditions of the construction of dominant narratives that shape Western society. pilarmatadupont.com
profile_positions.title: Artist

profile_positions.description: Dutied included: working with artists Pauline Boudry and Renate Lorenz, producer Giulia di Pietro, and curator, Maaike Gouwenberg, on the installation of the video and dance installation (No)Time, as part of the June festival at TENT, Rotterdam (unfortunately cancelled last minute). Overseeing transport, production and installation schedules, technical lists, budget, and sourcing equipment.
profile_positions.title: Producer - Art Directions

profile_positions.description: Working with director, Sally Richardson, giving feedback on online video development of dance theatre work 'Feminism has no Borders'.
profile_positions.title: Dramaturge

profile_positions.description: I worked with theatre director, Sally Richardson, and her collaborator, Ashley de Prazer, consulting on the visual development of the dance theatre work, 'Gui Shu (Belong)' at the Perth Institute of Contemporary Arts (PICA), supported by Performing Lines Western Australia. I also gave dramaturgical and technical support on the accompanying video installation piece that was first exhibited at PICA.
profile_positions.title: Visual Dramaturge

profile_positions.description:
Producer Audio-Visual for Piet Zwart Fine Arts Graduation exhibition, 'Midnight Sunburn' at Het Nieuwe Instituut, Rotterdam, working with Nathalie Hartjes and Showroom MAMA. 
Duties included: working with individual students to realise their AV installations, sourcing borrowed equipment (HNI, TENT, Witte de With) and sourcing sponsorship with Squat Deluxe (audio rental), overseeing the installation of AV artworks, writing technical lists and plans, creation of AV instruction manual for invigilation crew at Het Nieuwe Instituut.
profile_positions.title: Producer - Audio-Visual

profile_positions.description:
A 22 minute cabaret performance of 'The disoriented cabaret' performed in Arnhem at the Dutch Art Institute and at The Church at Greylight Projects in Brussels, Belgium.

Synopsis: The Complexity Fatigue is a young woman from Molenbeek in Brussels. She meets The Affirmative Prison, her son, The Ventriloquist, and The Meme Journalist on a stage for the attempt to create an opera together. 
'The disoriented cabaret' is a collaborative exercise of language production to make art beyond the current fear of system complexity and the interdependency of individuals.


Libretto by 
Mathilde Sauzet Mattei 

Composed by 
Gabriel Mattei

Cast
The Complexity Fatigue
Sonia Kazovsky

The Affirmative Prison 
Pilar Mata Dupont

The Ventriloquist
Gabriel Mattei

The Meme Journalist
Germaine Sijstermans
profile_positions.title: Performer - The disoriented cabaret

profile_positions.description:
Hold Your Horses is an interdisciplinary collective founded in 2009 by artists Theo Costantino, Tarryn Gill and Pilar Mata Dupont. Our vision is to support the creation of innovative works that are engaging, challenging and stimulating in their relevance to contemporary culture and identity. We are particularly interested in the reappraisal and reimagining of history as a means to interrogate its legacy in the present day.

www.hyh.com.au
profile_positions.title: Co-Artistic Director
